9231/12

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[782, 301, 905, 316]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 355, 393, 370]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 383, 393, 399]]<|/det|>
You will need: List of formulae (MF19)  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 418, 222, 434]]<|/det|>
## INSTRUCTIONS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 435, 275, 450]]<|/det|>
Answer all questions.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 450, 760, 466]]<|/det|>
Use a black or dark blue pen. You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 466, 808, 482]]<|/det|>
Write your name, centre number and candidate number in the boxes at the top of the page.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 482, 562, 497]]<|/det|>
Write your answer to each question in the space provided.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 498, 485, 512]]<|/det|>
Do not use an erasable pen or correction fluid.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 513, 359, 527]]<|/det|>
Do not write on any bar codes.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 528, 866, 559]]<|/det|>
If additional space is needed, you should use the lined page at the end of this booklet; the question number or numbers must be clearly shown.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 560, 480, 575]]<|/det|>
You should use a calculator where appropriate.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 575, 880, 606]]<|/det|>
You must show all necessary working clearly; no marks will be given for unsupported answers from a calculator.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 606, 860, 637]]<|/det|>
Give non- exact numerical answers correct to 3 significant figures, or 1 decimal place for angles in degrees, unless a different level of accuracy is specified in the question.  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 666, 212, 680]]<|/det|>
## INFORMATION  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 682, 384, 697]]<|/det|>
The total mark for this paper is 75.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 698, 729, 713]]<|/det|>
The number of marks for each question or part question is shown in brackets [ ].

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[79, 72, 96, 88]]<|/det|>
<label>1</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 72, 144, 88]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 71, 677, 88]]<|/det|>
Use standard results from the list of formulae (MF19) to show that

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[349, 106, 645, 150]]<|/det|>
\[\sum_{r = 1}^{n}(2 - 3r)(5 - 3r) = a n^{3} + b n^{2} + c n,\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 163, 520, 183]]<|/det|>
where \(a, b\) and \(c\) are integers to be determined.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 163, 920, 183]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 74, 94, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>2</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 74, 532, 94]]<|/det|>
The cubic equation \(x^{3} + 2x + 1 = 0\) has roots \(\alpha , \beta , \gamma .\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 106, 146, 125]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 106, 631, 125]]<|/det|>
Find a cubic equation whose roots are \(\alpha^{3} - 1, \beta^{3} - 1, \gamma^{3} - 1\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 106, 920, 125]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 79, 146, 98]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 75, 546, 100]]<|/det|>
Find the value of \(\left(\alpha^{3} - 1\right)^{2} + \left(\beta^{3} - 1\right)^{2} + \left(\gamma^{3} - 1\right)^{2}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 78, 920, 98]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 520, 185, 539]]<|/det|>
<label>(c)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[186, 518, 546, 543]]<|/det|>
Find the value of \(\left(\alpha^{3} - 1\right)^{3} + \left(\beta^{3} - 1\right)^{3} + \left(\gamma^{3} - 1\right)^{3}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 521, 920, 540]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 72, 92, 89]]<|/det|>
<label>3</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 72, 737, 92]]<|/det|>
The sequence \(u_{1}, u_{2}, u_{3}, \ldots\) is such that \(u_{1} = 5\) and \(u_{n + 1} = 6u_{n} + 5\) for \(n \geqslant 1\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 103, 146, 121]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 102, 638, 121]]<|/det|>
Prove by induction that \(u_{n} = 6^{n} - 1\) for all positive integers \(n\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 102, 920, 121]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 835, 186, 853]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 835, 504, 853]]<|/det|>
Deduce that \(u_{2n}\) is divisible by \(u_{n}\) for \(n \geqslant 1\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 835, 920, 853]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 81, 97, 101]]<|/det|>
<label>4</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[119, 73, 692, 109]]<|/det|>
The matrix \(\mathbf{M}\) is given by \(\mathbf{M} = \begin{pmatrix} 1 & 2 \\ 0 & 1 \end{pmatrix} \begin{pmatrix} \cos \theta & -\sin \theta \\ \sin \theta & \cos \theta \end{pmatrix}\), where \(0 < \theta < 2\pi\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 123, 144, 141]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 123, 851, 144]]<|/det|>
The matrix \(\mathbf{M}\) represents a sequence of two geometrical transformations in the \(x - y\) plane.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 154, 918, 175]]<|/det|>
State the type of each transformation, and make clear the order in which they are applied. [2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 560, 186, 579]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[186, 560, 920, 580]]<|/det|>
Find the value of \(\theta\) for which the transformation represented by \(\mathbf{M}\) has a line of invariant points. [7]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 77, 92, 96]]<|/det|>
<label>5</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 77, 569, 98]]<|/det|>
The curve \(C\) has polar equation \(r = \theta \mathrm{e}^{\frac{1}{\theta}\theta}\), for \(0\leqslant \theta \leqslant 2\pi\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 109, 144, 128]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 109, 235, 128]]<|/det|>
Sketch \(C\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 109, 920, 128]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 405, 146, 424]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 405, 920, 444]]<|/det|>
Find the area of the region bounded by \(C\) and the initial line, giving your answer in the form \(\left(p\pi^2 + q\pi + r\right)\mathrm{e}^{\frac{1}{2}\pi} + s\), where \(p, q, r\) and \(s\) are integers to be determined.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 421, 920, 440]]<|/det|>
<mark>[6]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 241, 143, 259]]<|/det|>
<label>(c)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 240, 599, 260]]<|/det|>
Show that, at the point of \(C\) furthest from the initial line,

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[395, 268, 603, 294]]<|/det|>
\[\theta \cos \theta +\left(\frac{1}{8}\theta +1\right)\sin \theta = 0\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[151, 303, 618, 322]]<|/det|>
and verify that this equation has a root between 5 and 5.05.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 304, 920, 322]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 73, 144, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>(c)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 73, 831, 92]]<|/det|>
Find the values of \(t\) such that the shortest distance between the lines \(AB\) and \(CD\) is \(\sqrt{2}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 73, 920, 92]]<|/det|>
<mark>[7]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 103, 915, 123]]<|/det|>
<form>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 81, 94, 100]]<|/det|>
<label>7</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 76, 460, 107]]<|/det|>
The curve \(C\) has equation \(y = \frac{2x^2 - 5x}{2x^2 - 7x - 4}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 120, 146, 139]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 120, 487, 139]]<|/det|>
Find the equations of the asymptotes of \(C\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 120, 917, 139]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 368, 186, 387]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[188, 368, 551, 387]]<|/det|>
Find the coordinates of any stationary points on \(C\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 368, 917, 387]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 72, 144, 88]]<|/det|>
<label>(c)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 72, 677, 88]]<|/det|>
Sketch \(C\), stating the coordinates of the intersections with the axes.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 72, 920, 88]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 85, 144, 103]]<|/det|>
<label>(e)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 79, 700, 106]]<|/det|>
Find in exact form the set of values of \(x\) for which \(\left|\frac{2x^2 - 5x}{2x^2 - 7x - 4}\right| < \frac{1}{9}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[888, 82, 920, 101]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 102, 920, 136]]<|/det|>
